events.name: North Korea pandemic response
events.wd_description: North Korea has shut its borders to visitors and humanitarian aid since the start of the pandemic, and recent news indicates a lockdown in Pyongyang due to an outbreak of the Omicron variant.
events.description: North Korea has shut its borders to visitors and humanitarian aid since the start of the pandemic, and recent news indicates a lockdown in Pyongyang due to an outbreak of the Omicron variant.

events.name: Lockdown and panic buying
events.wd_description: Areas of Pyongyang were locked down for two days following news of the outbreak, leading to panic buying among citizens.
events.description: Areas of Pyongyang were locked down for two days following news of the outbreak, leading to panic buying among citizens.

events.name: Crisis meeting and health response
events.wd_description: Kim Jong-Un called a crisis meeting to address the outbreak. Health officials and front-line workers were deployed, and tests confirmed the Omicron variant.
events.description: Kim Jong-Un called a crisis meeting to address the outbreak. Health officials and front-line workers were deployed, and tests confirmed the Omicron variant.

events.name: Measures to control the outbreak
events.wd_description: Kim Jong-Un emphasized eliminating the outbreak quickly, leading to tighter border control, restricted citizen movement, and isolated production activities.
events.description: Kim Jong-Un emphasized eliminating the outbreak quickly, leading to tighter border control, restricted citizen movement, and isolated production activities.

events.name: Continued isolation
events.wd_description: Despite the outbreak, North Korea shows no signs of opening up to the world.
events.description: Despite the outbreak, North Korea shows no signs of opening up to the world.

events.name: Public session on Pacific weather patterns, June 2022
events.wd_label: Public session on Pacific weather patterns, June 2022
events.wd_description: US-based scientist Dr. Mike McPhaden held a public session in Sydney to discuss the current state of the Pacific, focusing on the potential for a rare triple La Niña event and its implications for Australia’s weather.
events.description: US-based scientist Dr. Mike McPhaden held a public session in Sydney to discuss the current state of the Pacific, focusing on the potential for a rare triple La Niña event and its implications for Australia’s weather.

events.name: Discussion on El Niño and La Niña
events.wd_label: Discussion on El Niño and La Niña
events.wd_description: The session covered the significance of surface temperatures in the Nino 3.4 region of the tropical Pacific Ocean in determining the occurrence of El Niño or La Niña events.
events.description: The session covered the significance of surface temperatures in the Nino 3.4 region of the tropical Pacific Ocean in determining the occurrence of El Niño or La Niña events.

events.name: Potential triple La Niña
events.wd_description: Dr. McPhaden highlighted the rarity of a triple La Niña, which could continue into 2023, bringing increased rainfall and lower temperatures to Australia’s east coast.
events.description: Dr. McPhaden highlighted the rarity of a triple La Niña, which could continue into 2023, bringing increased rainfall and lower temperatures to Australia’s east coast.

events.name: Role of global heating in weather events
events.wd_label: Role of global heating in weather events
events.wd_description: The session also touched on the potential influence of global heating on the current and future weather events, though scientists are still studying its impact on storm activities.
events.description: The session also touched on the potential influence of global heating on the current and future weather events, though scientists are still studying its impact on storm activities.

events.name: Sweden and Finland's NATO membership bid
events.wd_label: Sweden and Finland's NATO membership bid
events.wd_description: Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO requires unanimous agreement by all current members, but Turkey's President Erdogan opposes the move due to past sanctions and alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.
events.description: Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO requires unanimous agreement by all current members, but Turkey's President Erdogan opposes the move due to past sanctions and alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.

events.name: Turkey's opposition
events.wd_description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan opposed Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO, citing sanctions placed on Turkey and their alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.
events.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan opposed Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO, citing sanctions placed on Turkey and their alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.

events.name: Statements from Sweden and Finland
events.wd_description: The Finnish foreign minister stated that Finland would not negotiate with Turkey, while the Swedish Prime Minister emphasized NATO's role in strengthening Sweden in the new European reality.
events.description: The Finnish foreign minister stated that Finland would not negotiate with Turkey, while the Swedish Prime Minister emphasized NATO's role in strengthening Sweden in the new European reality.

events.name: Russia cuts natural gas supplies
events.wd_description: Russia will cut natural gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in rubles, escalating tensions with the West.
events.description: Russia will cut natural gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in rubles, escalating tensions with the West.

events.name: PGNiG statement
events.wd_description: PGNiG, Poland's state-run gas company, stated that Gazprom informed it on April 26 of the decision to fully suspend deliveries under the Yamal contract starting April 27.
events.description: PGNiG, Poland's state-run gas company, stated that Gazprom informed it on April 26 of the decision to fully suspend deliveries under the Yamal contract starting April 27.

events.name: Suspension of gas supplies
events.wd_description: PGNiG announced it would suspend gas supplies along the Yamal pipeline starting Wednesday morning.
events.description: PGNiG announced it would suspend gas supplies along the Yamal pipeline starting Wednesday morning.

events.name: Market reaction
events.wd_description: The news of the suspension sent US natural gas futures up about 3% on Tuesday.
events.description: The news of the suspension sent US natural gas futures up about 3% on Tuesday.
